page.title: 13Memorial Hall,Longtown.
page.content: The Longtown Memorial Hall Community Centre's original building was erected by the people of Longtown in rememberance of those who died in the First World War,funded by individual contributions,and even donations of the cost of single bricks.The extension to that first building was completed in 1981 in order to offer a wider range of facilities, and hopefully enhance its attraction to the community.Membership is open to the Parishes of Arthuret,Westlinton, Kirkandrews-on-Esk,Kirklinton Middle, Stapleton,Solport,Nicholforest and Bewcastle,costing Â£1/year for pensioners and juniors,Â£2 for adults,and a family concession of Â£4.Facilities include 2 Squash Courts,Multi-Gym,Meeting Room,Coffee Bar,and Showers.It is intended to establish a Garden of Rememberance.
